revised_title: Inductions by the Evocator-Glycogen Complex in Amphibian Embryos
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the role of the evocator-glycogen complex in amphibian embryos. They found that both lyo- and desmo-glycogen can induce neural tissue in embryos. The induced neural tissue, however, lacks regional organization and does not form specific body structures. This suggests that the evocator-glycogen complex plays a role in early developmental processes but may not be responsible for the formation of specific body parts.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
